X.label: Individualism vs. Collectivism
X.description: Measures how a leader balances individual achievement with group harmony and collective goals

values.label: Highly Collectivist
values.description: Prioritizes group harmony and collective decision-making above individual needs
values.impact: Creates strong team cohesion but may slow down decision-making processes
examples: Japanese corporate leadership style emphasizing consensus-building
Leader who always consults team before making decisions

values.label: Moderately Collectivist
values.description: Emphasizes group consensus while still maintaining some individual autonomy
values.impact: Balanced approach that promotes collaboration while preserving individual input
examples: Scrum master in agile development teams
Department head who uses both team meetings and one-on-ones

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Equal emphasis on individual contributions and team collaboration
values.impact: Creates versatile environment suitable for different types of projects and teams
examples: Project manager who alternates between individual and team approaches

values.label: Moderately Individualistic
values.description: Encourages individual achievement while maintaining team coordination
values.impact: Drives innovation and personal growth while keeping team alignment
examples: Startup founder who empowers individual creativity
Research team leader who assigns independent projects

values.label: Highly Individualistic
values.description: Maximizes individual autonomy and personal achievement
values.impact: Fosters innovation but may challenge team cohesion

Y.label: Emotional vs. Rational
Y.description: Balances emotional intelligence with logical decision-making

values.label: Highly Emotional
values.description: Leads primarily through emotional intelligence and interpersonal connections
values.impact: Builds strong relationships but may struggle with tough decisions

values.label: Moderately Emotional
values.description: Emphasizes emotional intelligence while maintaining analytical thinking
values.impact: Creates supportive environment while keeping focus on objectives
examples: HR director who balances employee welfare with business needs
School principal combining empathy with academic standards

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Equal emphasis on emotional intelligence and rational analysis
values.impact: Versatile leadership style suitable for complex situations
examples: Medical department chief balancing patient care with efficiency
Product manager considering both user emotions and data

values.label: Moderately Rational
values.description: Prioritizes data-driven decisions while maintaining emotional awareness
values.impact: Efficient decision-making with consideration for human factors

values.label: Highly Rational
values.description: Focuses on logic, data, and systematic analysis
values.impact: Excellent for technical decisions but may overlook human factors

Z.label: Risk-Averse vs. Risk-Taking
Z.description: Determines approach to uncertainty and innovation

values.label: Highly Risk-Averse
values.description: Prioritizes safety and certainty in all decisions
values.impact: Maintains stability but may miss opportunities

values.label: Moderately Risk-Averse
values.description: Takes calculated risks after thorough analysis
values.impact: Balances opportunity with security

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Evaluates risks and rewards equally
values.impact: Adaptable approach suitable for varying situations
examples: Portfolio manager balancing growth and security

values.label: Moderately Risk-Taking
values.description: Embraces calculated risks while maintaining some safeguards
values.impact: Drives innovation while managing potential downsides

values.label: Highly Risk-Taking
values.description: Actively seeks innovative and potentially disruptive opportunities
values.impact: Maximum potential for breakthroughs but higher chance of failure

high_impact.impact: Drives radical innovation but may face team alignment challenges
Creates stable, harmonious teams but may move slowly

descriptions.default: You are exploring a balanced leadership style that harmonizes individual goals with collective needs, balances emotions with rationality, and approaches risk with caution.
descriptions.example: A leader focusing on personal growth, making data-driven decisions, and embracing calculated risks.

X.label: Hierarchical vs. Flat Structure
X.description: Defines the organization's power distribution and decision-making flow

values.label: Strict Hierarchy
values.description: Clear chain of command with multiple management levels
values.impact: Clear accountability but slower decision-making

values.label: Moderate Hierarchy
values.description: Defined reporting structure with some flexibility
values.impact: Balance of clarity and adaptability

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Mix of hierarchical and flat elements
values.impact: Adaptable to different situations and projects
examples: Hybrid organization with both traditional and agile teams

values.label: Moderately Flat
values.description: Few management layers with emphasis on team autonomy
values.impact: Fast decision-making but potential coordination challenges

values.label: Flat Structure
values.description: Minimal hierarchy with distributed authority
values.impact: Maximum flexibility but potential chaos in scaling

Y.label: Task-Oriented vs. People-Oriented
Y.description: Balance between focus on objectives and human factors

values.label: Highly Task-Oriented
values.description: Primary focus on deliverables and efficiency
values.impact: High productivity but potential burnout risk

values.label: Moderately Task-Oriented
values.description: Emphasis on results while considering human factors
values.impact: Good productivity with sustainable practices

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Equal focus on tasks and people
values.impact: Sustainable performance with good team satisfaction

values.label: Moderately People-Oriented
values.description: Prioritizes employee welfare while maintaining productivity
values.impact: High engagement but may sacrifice some efficiency

values.label: Highly People-Oriented
values.description: Maximum focus on human development and satisfaction
values.impact: Excellent retention but may lack competitive edge

values.label: Highly Process-Driven
values.description: Strict adherence to established procedures
values.impact: High reliability but resistant to change

values.label: Moderately Process-Driven
values.description: Structured processes with room for improvement
values.impact: Reliable operations with some flexibility

values.label: Balanced
values.description: Mix of standard processes and innovation
values.impact: Adaptable while maintaining consistency

values.label: Moderately Innovation-Driven
values.description: Emphasis on new ideas while maintaining some structure
values.impact: High innovation with manageable risk

values.label: Highly Innovation-Driven
values.description: Continuous experimentation and change
values.impact: Maximum creativity but potential instability

high_impact.impact: Highly adaptable but may struggle with scale

descriptions.default: Exploring organizational dynamics that balance structure with flexibility, and processes with innovation.
descriptions.example: An organization emphasizing team collaboration, prioritizing employee well-being, and fostering innovation.
